name: Le Meridien Etoile

reviews.text: Great experience at Le Meridien Etoile! Service was very good, renovated room was also very nice (although the renovated hallway is already showing some wear and tear.) Location is good - easy to walk plus metro is very close by. Air France bus from airport to basically hotel's front door is a big plus.
reviews.title: Nice alternative to more expensive hotels
Nice staff but rooms need renovating
reviews.text: Stayed Feb. 17- 21 using Starwood points for equivalent of about $300/night. Staff is friendly and accomodating, very patient with giving recs and directions. We had requested early checkin but were told they were preparing us for an "upgraded" room on Starwood floor. (We opted to go sightseeing and checked in later.) The room wasn't bad, comfy and clean bed, but bathroom had a crack in the sink and what looked like cigarette burns in the tub (photos attached). Also, bathroom door is just a sliding door with a big gap (hello, privacy alert!). Probably wouldn't have stayed here if not using our points and if we had to pay full fare. Also, not a hip part of town restaurant-wise, but definitely recommend Zinc Caius restaurant a few blocks away (excellent food and wine pairings!) as well as the chocolate patissierie down the street (delicious pain du chocolate for 2 Euros!). Little markets nearby too if you want to pick up bottled water and wine. Last, check your bill for mini-bar items you didn't use!
The lobby is big and it can be tricky to find the reception area if you enter through the revolving doors. Check-in was fast and very efficient, and with a smile from the staff.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are tiny and if you have a lot of luggage it is very cramped. Equipment in the rooms are modern and up to standard. Very fanzy shower room with a "glass-wall" facing the bed room area. The glass is decorated though, so only providing some light and not complete view. Very nice.
reviews.title: Ok. But there are better deals in Paris

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit outdated and you can hear noice from connecting rooms.
reviews.title: too much, and too far from.... they also steal, so watch your valuables

reviews.text: The Meridien Etoile is located in the west part of Paris. it is close to the Palais des Congrès, meaning that most clients are congress participants and can be considered as a "captive pool of clients". The hotel was recently renovated, the rooms are small but well furnished. The prices are very high in light of the quality but most people benefit from discount congress rates. Internet connection is charged independently at high price.
reviews.title: Not priced for value and well below standards !
It's ok but It's not a 4 star hotel
reviews.text: The main issue with this Hotel is the lack of proper management. I stayed during a large international congress and the hotel was full. There was only a small room dedicated to breakfast meaning that between 7:30 and 9:30 people had to queue for 45 mn to attend a crowded breakfats room. i tried to alert the manager who was extremely arrogant and stated that the queuing time was no more than 10 mn which was not true !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary this hotel is only suited for congress attendees who do not have a better choice. Tourists have much nicer locations and better deals in central Paris
reviews.title: OK, near from the center

reviews.text: The Meridien Etoile is not a 4 star hotel in my opinion.
reviews.title: Nice stay for the holidays
Very very bad choice!!!!!
reviews.text: Cons:

Good Location, fanastic hotel, rooms are small in size can accomodate 2 Adults, Close to the Champs Elysees, Staffs are highly helpful, Breakfast good, no pool in the hotel, over all good for Leisure and Business Travellers
reviews.title: XMAS IN PARIS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am typing this review from the lobby of the Meridien, and this would be my only real complaint--the high cost of internet in your room. I am on the third floor and there are two computers here for our free use, but if the internet was not 25€ per day, I would have paid to have it in my room. At the current conversion rate (Dec. 2012) this means paying over $30 per night for internet access... ouch!
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel... Stay Here!

reviews.text: Still, the good far outweighs the bad.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Good but no surpises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The location is perfect. You can walk to the Arch de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower is a short train ride away. We actually walked there too, but I would only suggest that if you have a true affinity for walking. The hotel is right next to the metro and you can get to any major attraction quite easily.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ignored the reviews and heeded the manager's replies and discounted rate I received on priceline. It was a big mistake. I stayed at 3 hotels over a 2 week stay in Paris. All were booked through priceline and this one was definitely the worst. The location is the best part; although, it was further from most of the sites (except the arc) than my other hotels. The initial room we were placed in smelled strongly of smoke and had cigarette butts on the floor. They were nice about putting us in a new room, which smelled much better, but as many have mentioned in other reviews was badly in need of rennovation. I have never before contemplated taking pics of a hotel room but did this time, because it was so much less than expected from a 4* hotel.When we asked to be switched to the new rooms, we were told priceline customers are not eligible to stay in those rooms.
reviews.title: Not worth it even with priceline

reviews.text: Everytime I went to the front desk another poor customer was arguing with staff about some charge they had received inappropriately. Because of this I was super vigilant not to make any phone calls or touch the mini bar. Overall, it was not a pleasant experience. Staff were not rude but did not make any effort to be friendly.
reviews.title: Terrible internet - very very slow

reviews.text: I expected much more and will definitely steer clear of Le Meridien in the future. There are much better options for less money available in Paris.
reviews.title: Convenient, quiet and well located

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel more than once for my business trips. The information given by other travellers about the vast difference between the room types is true.
reviews.title: modern and classy

reviews.text: The reason I'm writing this review is to give feedback to the hotel management as well as inform travellers to be. Internet access used to be fuss-free BUT on my most recent trip, internet has deterioated to to level of unacceptability. I've enquired and it appears that there has been a change in the internet operator. If that is true, I hope the hotel will change to another operater ASAP, as internet is now so slow I can't surf the internet without long (read several minutes) loading pages.
reviews.title: They charge for anything

reviews.text: I was surprised at all of the negative reviews for this hotel - I really enjoyed my 3 nights there for a work trip.
reviews.title: very modern and comfortable for your stay in paris
Nice!
reviews.text: Highlights:
1) Hotel is modern and quite comfortable - lots of lobby space for chatting and hanging out, which is not typical in Paris
reviews.title: Nice stay, but housekeeping broke my clock

reviews.text: 2) I ordered room service twice, and it was quick and pretty good
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel with a fab Jazz club!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) It is maybe a 10 minute walk to the Arc De Triomphe and the start of the Champs Elysees - which is a lovely walk, of course. It is also close to the business district - maybe 10 minutes by cab.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Booked this room, well in advance, through Priceline, knowing that it was going to be stay over new year's eve. Paid $164 USD/night for a total of $361.76 for two nights including all taxes and fees. It seems the rate paid will highly influence perceptions at this hotel. There is no way I would feel well if I paid the over $500 euros rate per night that is posted on the sign on the front desk.
reviews.title: Paris for New Years

likes.liked: — Vibrant lobby, location close to transit, hotel brand Le Meridien.

reviews.text: My son and I arrived on the TGV from Geneva at 1:30 p.m. Waited for about 10 minutes at the check-in desk. All positions were open and busily serving other guests, it was just that busy. Upon check-in I was informed that the hotel was fully booked for new years; but I was still able to check in early to a room that was already cleaned. We were given room 1093.
reviews.title: Perfect room, perfect experience

likes.liked: — The large size and comfort of the Executive room

reviews.text: Since I had booked this hotel quite early I had almost a year to read the ongoing reviews of this hotel and the rennovation project that was going on. I was fully prepared for what I experienced.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway
Made the right choice
reviews.text: First off, I did not get one of the newly rennovated rooms, which really didn't bother me too much. However, the constant noise through the walls all night long was maddening. To top it all off the construction noise started at 7:00 in the morning. I actually think they must have been jack hammering the tiles in the bathroom directly above our room. Long story short: typical Priceline room. Considering the room rate was relatively inexpensive, the hotel was in Paris, and it was new year's eve, and the fact that I always travel with ear plugs, it worked out O.K. My 21 year old never complained once about the noise.
There is FREE Internet on the 7th floor. When you exit from the elevator lobby on the 7th floor, turn left. There are two terminals in the hall. Everytime I checked there were occupied.
reviews.title: Liked our stay here in Paris

reviews.text: Le Meridien is a little on the old side. As an SPG gold member, we were given one of the upgraded rooms, but even at that, the bathrooms looked old and the rooms were tiny. The concierge folks seemed bothered by any and all questions asked. Are they not there to help us with a smile? I asked the concierge about the closest market for food and they directed me to this little hole in the wall market (2 right turns out of the hotel). Why he did not direct us to the full service, full size grocery store located across the street in Palais De Congres, I have no idea. It's a great grocery store, located literally across the street, in the lower level. On the other hand, the check-in front desk people were all smiles and helpful. As far as location, it's right next to the main street that leads to the Champs Elysee and the Metro stop is conveniently located, too.
reviews.title: 3 out of 5.

reviews.text: Nice hotel especially the lobby. The rooms are small and in need of refurbishing. Breakfast was fair, but to the price of $250 you expect much more. Staff was nice. Internet rate at $30 dollar is ridiculous, and so is $8 for a coke in the bar.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not worth the money.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff - highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 3 nights in April through Hotwire, so it therefore came at a great price (€60). The regular price (€160) is not as good value so my advice would be to shop around.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in a great location, with the Arc du Triomphe being a pleasant 5-10 minute walk away. The Porte-Maillot/Neuilly-Porte Maillot Metro station can be accessed within 2 minutes, from where direct trains to the Eiffel Tower, Champs-Elysees, Louvre, Musee D'orsay and Notre Dame can be taken.
reviews.title: Good Stay for the Price!

reviews.text: Overall stars - 3.5 of 5
reviews.title: Fall short of Le Meridien standards but overall was ok
What a mess!
reviews.text: Hotel staff -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception / business center: 4 of 5
reviews.title: Tale of Two Hotels (with poor service)

reviews.text: Concierge: 2 of 5, were not very knowledgeable on few occasions, advise & directions given to me and other which I overheard while waiting were vague and non-specific)
reviews.title: Reasonable and good location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant staff - did not use
reviews.title: Reasonable stay at Le Meridien Etoile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights for a birthday/ early Valentine's celebration. We booked on Hotwire and got a pretty good deal (At the hotel front desk, the hotel fare was listed at 500euros/ night!). It's definitely NOT worth 500euros/ night! So try to get a deal.
reviews.title: Do not pay full price! Average stay...

likes.liked: — Close to subway/ train, close to good restaurants
likes.disliked: — Not worth the full price, older hotel/ needs to update decor

reviews.title: Basic but highly competitively priced
reviews.text: The room we got was OK. The bathroom was clean (toilet in a separate room from sink and tub) and well-kept. The size was big in European standards. There was a LCD TV. Try to buy water (for the night) before you go back to the hotel. The hotel charges 8euros per bottle of 250mL Evian. We were so thirsty on the first night that we had to succumb...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The walk to champs elysees/ arc de triomphe wasn't too bad... About a 10 minute walk. Le Meridien Etoile is VERY close to the Porte Maillot station (a minute walk away, not even), so it was really convenient to go to LaFayette, Eiffel Tower, Chateau de Versailles, La Vallee shopping factory outlets (at the Val d'europe station- where you will find Burberry, Ferragamo, Armani, Agnes B, Paul Smith, Polo, Bally, etc. at AWESOME prices! You can also get a tax refund on anything over 175euros bought in one store), Le Louvre museum, Notre Dame, etc. by subway or train. The hotel offers a Versailles tour/ excursion for 147euros/ person. We took the train there for 6euros (return fare). It's about 45 minutes one-way. The ticket to enter was around 20euros for a self-guided tour (they give you a headset and recorder). Versailles was beautiful (as with everything else!)...
reviews.title: Not what you expect from Starwood

reviews.text: There's also a shopping centre with a grocery/ supermarket across the street from the hotel. We bought our water/ drinks there.
reviews.title: Ok
What a scam
reviews.text: There are many restaurants offering breakfast/ lunch/ dinner sets around the hotel. Breakfast is usually 10 to 20 euros depending on what you eat. You can get a 3-course lunch with champagne and a bottle of red wine for around 35 euros. If you like steak, try the L'Entrecote restaurant just behind the hotel (and across 2 small streets) for dinner. There's ALWAYS a line-up but if you go early, you should be able to get in (Dinner starts at 7pm- we went to line up at 6:30pm on our last evening there and got a really nice table on the 2nd floor by the window). You get bread, salad, and steak with fries (they come back to you for a 2nd serving) for a good price (steak is the only thing they serve).

As often as I have visited Paris I have never enjoyed an hotel offering such spacious rooms and such pleasant staff. Platinum guests enjoy a dedicated check-in counter on the 8th floor providing seating during the check-in process. The breakfast lounge offers a stunning view of the city and a wide choice of food. The guest room was spacious with a flat screen tv offering a wide selection of channels. The bedding was immaculate and of very high quality. Definately a choice to consider!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, welcoming staff, impeccable room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Paris and this hotel was a great way to start! Checked in much earlier than the specified check in time, with no extra cost, and the room was nice with a comfy bed and clean bathroom. Friendly helpful staff too. Very close to main sights. All round great stay and would definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from the Meridien Etoile. I booked a great deal with Priceline.
reviews.title: Good Value if you can have a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is very well located next to the Metro (line 1 which bring you directly to the Champs Elysees, the Louvre and the Halles) and RER. By foot, it's only a 15 min. walk to the Arc the Triomphe.
reviews.title: Where did the 5 star rating come from?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was very good and very helpful. For a few bucks we were upgraded on arrival to the new Design Executive Rooms.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: Location convinient. Air-France bus stops accross the street.
reviews.title: NO heat, no hot water and air-hammer in use that's what to expect

likes.disliked: — the lack of a funtional room, no heat , no warm water and a lot of noise from the remodelling

reviews.text: Room small but OK. Heat didn't work in the room. Next morning the shower water was not warm. At 8 am an airhammer started as the hotel is under re-modelling.- No warning about this at check in.
reviews.title: Maintenance overwhelming

reviews.text: Breakfast very,very expensive. And Mini bar 9 Euro ($ 14) for a beer!
reviews.title: OK hotel for the value

reviews.text: The Starwood chain needs to do better job. After all this is regarded as a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: A decent, functional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has gone through a nice room upgrade over the last year, but the upgrade is not complete. New rooms have a new flat screen television and updated furniture. The biggest problem was the constant sound of the upgrades during the day. I was there for a week with a large group attending a convention at the Palais de Congres. I would not trade the convenience of the hotel to the convention center for a less noisy site, but if I were there to enjoy the City of Lights, I would have gone insane. The hammer drill sound started daily at about 9 AM and went on throughout the day. The staff actually asked many times during the stay if the noise 'bothered' me. At first I thought it was limited to the floor, but with most of the hotel attending the conference, I quickly found that everyone felt like they had the construction crew right next door to them.
reviews.title: Hated the maintenance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel around New Year's. The hotel itself is ok, nothing too spectacular. It is about a 10 min walk to the nearest metro station so not bad. On the way you will find decent cafes and food stands, especially to grab a delicious crepe or small morning meal. While the room was clean, the place is in need of an update, it just feels somewhat dated. Can't complain about the bed though, it was a nice king size, and very, very comfortable. The shower had issues with water temp, so while showering the water was either too cold or too hot. No matter how much we played with the knobs and also tested at various times of day (not during the height of morning shower time), the water was never as it should have been. The closest comfort level was somewhere in the middle where both hot and cold water would shoot out of different different showerhead openings, creating streams of frigid and scorching water that would hit your skin. This was not too much of a problem, but still in the winter one usually wants to enjoy a warm, pleasant shower.
reviews.title: Ok base for Paris, nothing too special though

reviews.text: The biggest issue was with the staff, who were not flat out rude but also not particularly nice. When we checked in there was no discussion, no polite 'please' or 'thank you', and no 'do you have any questions.' Also through out the transaction she continued talking to her colleague as if this was the right time for a session of hilarious story telling. Upon check out, I lined up at one of the roped off areas (with our bags), however that area apparently no longer open. All this would have required of the receptionist was to move while handing me the papers, a mere few inches. She however stared at me blankly as I stumbled up to the counter (again w/ the bags) and kept looking, not moving an inch, not saying anything, until I moved around the roped off area to where SHE stood. No apologies, no acknowledgement of clearly not being helpful followed. In the process of handing me the bill she struck up a conversation with a co-worker, delaying the process for us and making it impossible for me to ask a question about luggage storage. After giving me the check out documents she again did not thank me, and when she noticed that I had not moved she looked away from her friend with a puzzled look. Despite my annoyance I nicely asked about bag storage to which she replied with a finger pointing at another, nondescript desk in the lobby. Basically telling me in her actions and her words, that this was not her problem anymore and I should stop wasting her time.
reviews.title: Excellent staff at reception desk specially miss audrey

reviews.text: In a nutshell it is an ok hotel with inexperienced or uncaring staff.
reviews.title: Enjoying our 7 days in Paris and Le Meridien

reviews.text: I liked everything in this hotel, location is excellent near walking distance from the champs elysees and metro station . Hotel looks very nice, huge and modern. The room was large, clean , comfortable. But the greatest values of this hotel are personal , all of them were extremelly helpful and kind , especially young team at reception desk. I am specially thankfull to miss Audrey at reception, who helped me that by telephone resolve one complicated issue with one touristic agency in Paris. I recommend this hotel for the stay in Paris.
reviews.title: Good functional hotel, easy transport, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What could have been a not so nice stay has turned into a great vacation thanks to the Le Meridien. When we arrived after our long flight of 7 hours, the rooms we had reserved were not available. We were assigned other rooms and one of the rooms was being used for a meeting. They found us more than adequate rooms for the night and recognized we were tired and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The next day they surprised us with an upgrade for our trouble and I am now sitting in my huge suite. Location is good about 1km from the Champs Elysees and shopping Lafayette across the street with a supermarket in the basement. I like it here in this area, quieter, less tourists and some really great cafe's and restaurants around. Taxis are always waiting outside to take us where we want if we don't feel like walking. Room service is great and efficient, food is good. Air conditioning for me was a must since I've stayed in Paris before without a.c. and the Meridien's AC works better than most hotels in Paris. Concierge sold us tickets to the Louvre so we wouldn't have to stand in line and that was great! Hotel is very French modern style. We are REALLy enjoying our time at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel expresience

reviews.text: Very well connected with Airport through shuttle buses at regular interval just in front of hotel across the street. Porte maiott also just round the corner. Important attractions also just 15-20 mints walk. So location is an advantage, but that's not all. The hotel itself is such a beautiful piece of work, tastefully decorated and all modern amenities. Spacious rooms, big bathrooms with all modern amenities. Absolutely 5 star. The best experience came from THE JAZZ BAR. Great drinks, great shows!! Would love to come back again and again!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Welcoming Staff, Beautiful Rooms

reviews.text: Good location makes it attractive for tourist and business trips - the proximity to the metro and the Congress Palace. I would not recommend the hotel for families with children. As well as wanting to plunge into the atmosphere of Parisian. Тhe part of staff did not speak English
reviews.title: Good place for business and travel purposes

reviews.text: An excellent location. Air France shuttle bus from the airport is right opposite the hotel. The metro station is nearby and a grocery shop is in the mall opposite to the hotel. Champs Elysees is walkable. Service is excellent
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Like the old real state adage: location, location, location. If you are going to Paris try to stay at the Meridien Etoile. Not exactly friendly on the pocket but the location is just fantastic. A half a block or so and you are at the Champs Elysees and then: let the walking begin!!
reviews.title: Location, location, location.

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and well maintained. There seems to be a lot of security. The rooms are modern and well appointed, comfortable. However, as a Sheraton Platinum member I was not very happy that a hotel of this caliber does not have a lounge, or at least the check in staff claimed that. Speaking of staff, all that we encountered were polite, friendly and helpful. Not the typical stereotype of Parisians. Stay at the Meridien and you'll be satisfied.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This is a perfectly functional mega hotel. If you don’t mind a well furnished convention hotel with impersonal service, you would find this property perfectly acceptable.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable mega hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Exhausting!! enjoyed every minute of my stay.

reviews.text: - Inexpensive, quick and easy airport transfer via frequent Air France buses that pick up right in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing Starwood Property - Uncomfortable bed/room

reviews.text: -An easy 15 minute stroll to Arc de Triumphe and Champs Elysee.
reviews.title: Great lobby and Jazz Bar-Very dated rooms but clean

reviews.text: -Located close to metro station. About 35 minutes away from Versailles via RER.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Decent Hotel - Not so comfortable bed and smelled of smoke
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in the early spring of 2008 and got a really great deal from Hotwire.com for this 4 star hotel. I would suggest getting a good online rate for this hotel since the going rate at the desk starts at 525 Euros! We requested a king size bed and after arriving to the room, realized that it was simply two twin bed squished together. The mattress was terribly stiff and you could actually feel a few of the springs throught the mattress. Having been smoked in previously, everything in the room smelled of smoke, especially the sheets and pillow cases.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The conceierge on the other hand were extremely helpful and being a 24 hour service, they really went above and beyond.
reviews.title: Very Poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel is great being within walking distance from the Champs-Elysees and other locations, but get a good online rate because it certainly isn't worth as much as they charge.
reviews.title: ok business hotel with not so great bed

reviews.text: I normally book a Meridien, Sheraton, Hilton because you know what you are getting. I should have realised that the reason this hotel is far cheaper than others is because it is poor.
reviews.title: Lucky for me, I didn't have to pay a single cent

reviews.text: Rooms are like cabins on a ship - small with even smaller bathrooms. I have been in nicer and larger toilets in a caravan. I am 6ft, 13st and found it hard to fit in so I really feel for some American friends trying to get in.
reviews.title: Do Not Be Deceived! Very Unclean Hotel

likes.liked: — The toilet flushing power is much better than the states.
likes.disliked: — Stained, dirty, run down. Rotten atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great. If you are willing to explore, there is a lot do do within walking distance. It is well connected for bus, metro and train.
reviews.title: This is a nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Morning breakfast buffet can be busy if you are arriving just after 8AM. Earlier (say 7:30 ish) got you a good selection of food and no line up to get in.
reviews.title: Comme ci, comme ca

likes.liked: — The Air France bus (ligne 2) that stop directly across the street from this hotel

reviews.title: A great, convenient, "jazzy" hotel
reviews.text: The room (2nd floor) was not sized like a North American hotel room but in comparison to most of the places we have stayed in Europe, the room size was quite good.

Stayed at Le Meridien Etoile for 3 nights during Easter. We booked it through hotwire, and were glad we didn’t pay rack rate…The hotel clearly has some issues, which has to be dealt with. From the outside the hotel looks a bit dated, with a 70s feel to it. You kind of forget about this as you step into the lobby, which is more up to date and sophisticated. When you stay at a 4 star hotel, you kind of expect some kind of professionalism and efficiency. We definitely experienced professionalism; the staff in the registration were extremely helpful and friendly – but it took almost 1 hour for us to check-in and that is not acceptable for a 4 star establishment! First we were given a standard room that literally reeked of smoke – even as it was stated to be a non-smoking room…I’ve never experienced such a smell before, and since I have asthma, I had to go back to the reception to try to get a new room. After 20 min in line, the staff were very helpful and understanding, and appointed us a new room – this time on the “Presidential Club floor”. As we entered the new room, we realized that someone else was staying there!!! So once more I had to walk down and line up in the enormous queue…. Got a new room, also on the Presidential Club floor – and was pleasantly surprised. The room was well-appointed, clean and tastefully decorated – not at all like the awful room we first were given! As many others have stated the hotel is located within walking distance from Arc de Triomphe, Champs-Elysees and many other locations. If you’re not up for walking the metro is right around the corner. If you get a reasonable online rate, it’s worth staying at. If you don’t – and you have to stay in a standard room, it’s not worth as much as they charge you for. We were lucky in the end – seems like many are not….
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: At least once a year I stay at Le Meridien Etoile, an once I stayed at the Montparnasse, so I must come to the defence of a good old faithful, that has everything a city-centre hotel should have and more..
reviews.title: Le Meridien - what a joke!!

description: Situated on the Right-Bank, Le Méridien Etoile is strategically located to appeal to business travelers and art-lovers alike as it faces the Paris Convention Centre, is steps away from the legendary Champs-Elysées and close to La Défense.The sophisticated 1,025 guestrooms include 21 suites and renovated Executive rooms. From a unique culinary escape at Ma Chère & Tendre to a night at the most celebrated jazz club in Paris, the jazz Club Etoile, Le Méridien Etoile provides a memorable Parisian evening.
